User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Shabakat Wallet application.

registrationDate.description: The date and time the user registered.

alWadiAccountId.description: Identifier for the user's Al-Wadi account.

lastNotificationRead.description: The timestamp of the last notification read by the user.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: Represents a transaction made by a user.

userId.description: Reference to the user who initiated the transaction. (Relationship: User 1:N Transaction)

transactionDate.description: The date and time the transaction occurred.

transactionType.description: The type of transaction (e.g., deposit, withdrawal, transfer).

recipientPhoneNumber.description: The phone number of the recipient (if applicable).

notes.description: Additional notes or details about the transaction.

Favorite.title: Favorite
Favorite.description: Represents a user's favorite transaction or contact.

userId.description: Reference to the user who created the favorite. (Relationship: User 1:N Favorite)

targetPhoneNumber.description: The phone number of the target of the favorite.

name.description: A user-defined name for the favorite.

AlwadiRenewalOption.title: AlwadiRenewalOption
AlwadiRenewalOption.description: Represents a renewal option for the Al-Wadi service.

id.description: Unique identifier for the renewal option.

title.description: The display title for the renewal option (e.g., 'تجديد شهرين').

price.description: The price of the renewal option in Yemeni Rial.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification sent to users.

body.description: The main content/message of the notification.

timestamp.description: The date and time the notification was created.

RenewalRequest.title: RenewalRequest
RenewalRequest.description: Represents a user's request to renew a service subscription.

id.description: Unique identifier for the renewal request.

userId.description: The ID of the user making the request.

userName.description: The name of the user making the request.

userPhoneNumber.description: The phone number of the user making the request.

packageTitle.description: The title of the renewal package.

packagePrice.description: The price of the renewal package.

subscriberName.description: The name of the subscriber for whom the renewal is requested.

cardNumber.description: The card number for the renewal.

status.description: The status of the renewal request.

requestTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the request was made.

PaymentMethod.title: PaymentMethod
PaymentMethod.description: Represents a payment method available in the app.

id.description: Unique identifier for the payment method.

name.description: The name of the payment service (e.g., 'بنك الكريمي').

accountHolderName.description: The name of the account holder.

accountNumber.description: The account number for the payment method.

logoUrl.description: URL of the payment method's logo.

imageUrl.description: The URL for the promotional image.

linkUrl.description: The URL to navigate to when the image is clicked.

Subscriber.title: Subscriber
Subscriber.description: Represents an Al-Wadi subscriber with a card number.

id.description: The card number, used as the unique ID.

name.description: The full name of the subscriber.

AppSettings.title: Application Settings
AppSettings.description: Stores global settings for the application.

appLink.description: The official shareable link for the application.

supportPhoneNumber.description: The WhatsApp number for customer support.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging, following the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC, and QAPs. User data and related entities (Transactions and Favorites) are organized under user-specific paths to maintain clear ownership. A new subcollection for personal notifications (`/users/{userId}/notifications`) is added to store user-specific alerts, such as balance top-ups from admins. This keeps personal notifications private and separate from global ones. Authorization Independence is achieved by storing all data relevant to a user within their dedicated path (`/users/{userId}`). This structure avoids `get()` calls in security rules. Segregation is enforced by storing distinct types of data (users, transactions, favorites) in separate collections, simplifying security rules. The structure also avoids the use of custom claims and relies solely on `request.auth.uid` for authorization.
